title: Download the installer (AppHub)
content:
Download the zip file from the software website to a control plane node.

The Helm chart versions are indicated using the x.x notation. Replace it with the version relevant to your deployment. For example, if your deployment needs version 25.2.0 Helm chart package, replace oo-helm-charts-1.x.x+26.x.x.zip with oo-helm-charts-1.7.0+25.2.0.zip. 

Follow these steps:

  1. Download the .zip file from the Software Licenses and Downloads website.
  2. Copy the file to a temporary directory on a control plane node. 
  3. Unzip the package: 
    unzip oo-helm-charts-1.x.x+26.x.x.zip

The following table describes the essential files inside the OO Containerized chart package:

Name

File

OO Helm chart file

oo-helm-charts-1.x.x+26.x.x/oo-1.x.x+26.x.x/oo-helm-charts/charts/oo-1.x.x+26.x.x.tgz

Example persistent volume and persistent volume claims yaml files

Persistent volume templates:
oo-helm-charts-1.x.x+26.x.x/oo-1.x.x+26.x.x/oo-helm-charts/samples/persistent_storage/on_premises/volumes.yaml

Persistent volume claims templates:
oo-helm-charts-1.x.x+26.x.x/oo-1.x.x+26.x.x/oo-helm-charts/samples/persistent_storage/on_premises/claims.yaml

Persistent volume Readme file:
oo-helm-charts-1.x.x+26.x.x/oo-1.x.x+26.x.x/oo-helm-charts/samples/persistent_storage/on_premises/README

Validate the chart signature

OPTIC AppHub validates Helm charts to ensure that they're digitally signed and aren't tampered with or corrupted.  If a chart fails signature validation, OPTIC AppHub displays a warning on the application tile. If there is no warning on the tile, the chart's signature validation is successful and you can deploy it.

Digital verification failed

If a chart is digitally signed, but the chart's SHA checksum doesn't match the checksum in the chart’s provenance file, someone may have tampered with the chart. In this scenario, OPTIC AppHub displays the Digital verification failed message. This means OPTIC AppHub couldn’t guarantee the authenticity of the chart and you won’t be able to deploy the application.  

It's recommended to obtain a new copy of the chart before proceeding.

Missing digital signature

If a chart’s provenance file is missing, OPTIC AppHub can’t validate the digital signature. In this scenario, OPTIC AppHub displays the Missing Digital Signature message. This may be due to the provenance file not being found in the chart directory because it's not an official chart or removed to circumvent the authenticity check. You can still deploy an unsigned chart, but you must acknowledge that you accept the risks associated with deploying a chart that isn't verified.

It's recommended to obtain a new copy of the chart before proceeding.
